website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy digital caliper that gives you an accurate reading every time, but make sure you keep some extra batteries nearby.
pros: Retains its accuracy well over time
Fraction display, so no math is required
cons: Some say the battery life is short, so have extras on hand

customer_reviews.title: drains battery when off
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received is absolute origin, turn it off, move, turn on and the measurement is still correct. This is achieved by keeping the unit active when turned off (in fact only the display is off) and indeed I measured 27uA current when off. The manufacturer very nicely send me a replacement unit but it behaves exactly the same way At this discharge rate a 225mAh capacity battery CR2032 should last about a year, mine both lasted a few months ( I assume the provided battery was not so good). Bottom line I keep the battery out when not in use which is ok for occasional use, but not for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate, not repeatable.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, it is one of many digital calipers I own, and it has a nice large display, but it is not accurate, and its not repeatable. It also does not have auto on, which I knew when I purchased it, I can live with that, but it is the most inconstant caliper that I own. To get it close to correct the tension needs to be so tight its almost not usable. Might be good for wood working, but not for my metal working and model makeing.
customer_reviews.author: digid

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I use this every few months, and the rest of the time, it lays in the drawer, unused, and off. However, every time I needed to use it, the battery was dead. I only use US-made top brand batteries, but it seems to consume the batteries even while off. Additionally, it gives the readings in 1/128 units, with no ability to round it to 1/32 or 1/16. so a spec of dust on a 3/8 thickness might read 49/128 (1/128 thicker than a 3/8), and you have to now start calculating fractions to figure out what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Born Free

customer_reviews.title: Replaced factory battery and now dead
customer_reviews.text: I only used the device a few times over the year or so I have owned it. I replaced the battery but for whatever reason when I put the battery cover back on it won't power up. If I remove the cover and hold the battery in place with something it works. Could never figure it out and gave up after an hour.
customer_reviews.author: J1976

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten a bad one and as this caliper has so many good ...
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a bad one and as this caliper has so many good reviews however when I measured mine with several different Mitutoyo and Starret Webber gage blocks I was getting different measurements from the back of the jaws to the front by quite a bit unlike what GadgetClass found in his tests and review. I also have to say I did not like the feel when adjusting the jaws, it was a bit stiff almost a dragging feel. The calipers were sent back immediately. I have a Capri Tools CP20001 Platinum Series Fractional Digital Caliper that I liked better and it actually measured pretty true.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed at the quality of the iGaging IP54 electronic caliper. It wasn't the cheapest one, but still reasonably priced. First, the battery drawer works just fine, it even comes with instructions on how to open it. That indicates that the manufacturer or listened to earlier feedback in reviews and fixed the issue. The accuracy of this is perfect for my use. There is not any play between the measuring slide LCD display and the ruler itself - none at all. The action is smooth and easy and it retains it's position, does not move a bit when you are measuring. I am very happy with this product, it appears to be more expensive than it sold for.
customer_reviews.author: Jetson T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Caliper/ Great Repeatability
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on the recommendation of a friend that is an engineer that builds industrial injection molding machines. I am using these primarily on industrial woodworking projects where I don't need as tight of tolerances, but I am still looking for +/- 0.003. The repeatability to come back to 0.000 every time is great. I have used other lower grade calipers that do not come back to 0.000 every time.
customer_reviews.author: KALVO

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly nice for the price, but be prepared to go through some batteries
customer_reviews.text: The calipers arrived with a dead battery. No worries, they provided an extra. That battery was gone in a month. Still no worries, those batteries were probably some budget brand manufactured during the Clinton administration. Well, truth is that this caliper will eat any battery in a month to six weeks. I have started keeping the battery tray pulled out when not in use. No idea yet if that helps. Otherwise, the fit, finish, accuracy and precision are good. I frequently check them against known standards and they are just as good as my trusty Mitutoyo dial calipers with the convenience of multi mode digital output. Just never be without a couple of spare batteries.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: This Caliper is of excellent quality and a good value price point
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a caliper that would not only be accurate for inches and mm, but also affordable. After reading several models reviews, I chose this one. The digital display is very large and easy to read. Settings convert from inches to MM with the push of a button. Auto off function if you forget to turn it off as well. With calipers fully closed, there is button to zero out the display as well, for very accurate measurements both inside and outside measurements. Replacement button batteries are readily available. My ONLY negative is the thumb wheel that operates the open and closing could be a bit tighter fit. But overall, I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth, and natural zeroing
customer_reviews.text: While I did want the absolute zero version of this caliper, my need didn't justify the extra cost. This unit and brand got recommendations from several reviewers and they were correct. It is straightforward and simple to use. When you zero it out, it always comes back to zero at starting position after using it, no artefacts or hysteresis, so it almost felt as good at the absolute positioning version. Very accurate, smooth running and well made. It is a USA company, but they farmed out the mfr to a chinese company, though with good quality control. A very good price/utility cost effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: Problem with the battery compartment will not stay in all the way.  it will allow dust and moisture to invade the circuitry
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this as I need it to replace a very old cheap plastic version I have had for over 40 years. But when unboxing the item, I could see there was a problem with the battery compartment and it was not seated correctly and after close examination I could see that the way the manufacturer put in the plastic strip between the battery and the connections was not seated correctly and now it will stay in. With this problem it will allow dust and moisture to invade the battery compartment and all the circuitry.
customer_reviews.author: michael the Sound Guy

customer_reviews.title: A nice tool at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Greal value. Definitely better than the other cheap digital calipers out there. It may be a few bucks more expensive than the el-cheap-o's but it's worth it. Nicely finished slides, repeatable zero, big, easy to read display. The case is even pretty decent. It may not be the heirloom-quality, precision-tool a Mitutoyo is, but it's definitely several steps above the other inexpensive competition.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K. Wimmer

customer_reviews.title: Out Of The Box It Measures Up
customer_reviews.text: I like that these use CR2032 batteries like so many other devices around the house - one less thing to keep stocked. I purchased these as a replacement for one of the ~$5 cheaper models where the battery compartment had failed in some weird way that prevented it from working with the cover attached. The design of this type should hopefully prevent that failure from occurring. The extra $5 provides a product that is incrementally better. It slides a little smoother and has less play in the mechanism. The fractional display is a nice feature when trying to sort a bunch of old drill bits, and when compared against items of known dimensions the accuracy is fine.
customer_reviews.author: YAAS(Yet Another Amazon Shopper)

customer_reviews.title: Good Calipers Overall, but Seriously Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in 2016. It's now 2020 so I've had some time with them. I'm your average guy. Amateur, DYI gunsmith with a Dremel and a dream. The calipers were often dead when I went to use them. I blamed it on the batteries so I tried a different brand with same result. These calipers draw power even when it's completely off. Enough to kill the battery. I've learned the hard way to take the battery out after each use. I think there are better options out there, but these work.
customer_reviews.author: BREWINZ

customer_reviews.title: These calipers are a lot of "bang for the buck"
customer_reviews.text: For someone who doesn't need great accuracy, this is a very good set of calipers. It has 3 'function buttons' which are rubber covered and simple push in and release. They control on/off, mm. vs. decimal inches, and fractions of an inch in xx/128ths. It comes with a spare CR2032 batter; a small plastic pull tab turns the caliper ON when new. Another nice touch is the foam lined, well cut-out, plastic storage box ... not fancy but very functional. It also ships with a cardboard box around the plastic box. This device is hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cole

customer_reviews.title: High quality you can see, and feel
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital caliper I've ever owned. I chose this one by watching a YouTube comparison video someone posted on Amazon. That person was 100% correct when he stated this $30 caliper is spot on accurate, and a quality instrument. It always goes back to zero when closed, and can be set for inches, mm, or digital. It comes in a sturdy foam lined case to protect it when not in use. It will come in handy when I'm setting up my dato stack on my table saw. I highly recommend this caliper for anyone needing accurate measurements. Thanks for the comparison video.
customer_reviews.author: Connie G

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these
customer_reviews.text: There are many digital calipers on the market. The reasons I purchased these, and like these are: 1) The forth digit to the right of the decimal point is displayed as large as the other digits. This makes the measurement much easier to read. Most of the calipers display this digit in a very small size. 2) The battery cover on this unit slides on and off easily. On many other units, they use a cover with a small screw to hold the battery in. I have had trouble striping and loosing this small screw. I like this simple cover much better.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Recommend but with one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: The IP54 accuracy (compared with my current micrometer and feeler gauges) and material quality is excellent. The case it comes in and the extra battery is also a very nice touch. I am still, months later, most impressed with this caliper. But as I wound up doing what should have been done at the factory (burnishing and beveling the laser/razor sharp edges and points), I dropped my rating from five to four stars. Having said that, I would still highly recommend this caliper especially at the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: rv8tor

customer_reviews.title: Use it daily
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not the best on the market, works great for some DIY CNC measuring. Seems to be very accurate and easy to use. Also like that you can switch from MM to inches by a press of the button. You can also lock it down once you find a certain width. Only reason I dropped a star was because the rollers is kind of....blahhh. It works well, but you need to add a bit of extra thumb force when moving it. Other than that, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Review Zone

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 months!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if 10 months is good or not. My last one lasted 5 years. Definitely not buying another one no matter how cheap. It worked well when if was actually working. You'll need to decide if you can afford to replace them every year.
customer_reviews.author: J. Freedman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool, priced for the occasional user
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an engineer and I'm not building an airplane, but every few weeks I have to measure something, and this tool fits the bill extremely well. Being a product of the US education system, I appreciate the ability to switch to metric when the need arises. I've had this for over 8 months now and still going strong on the first battery, so the reviewers that think it eats batteries are IMO, wrong. Nice build quality, great tool to have around. I do wish it were backlit, but I'm not usually measuring things in the dark, so it's fine. Can't go wrong with this great addition to your rulers drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: One of my many iGaging products.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box since early March 2020, I am surprised not having to hit the zero button once. Albeit I am careful with my tools but compared to much more expensive brands, this is very comparable in all areas such as accuracy, and fit and finish. It even feels expensive. It befuddles me not having to zero it at all though. My other iGaging tools serve me very well with no complaints, but I just had to leave a comment on this one. I take pride in the work I do but also credit the tools that carry me. And this is one of those tools.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dufresne

customer_reviews.title: Just arrive, but so far... VERY IMPRESSED.
customer_reviews.text: Come with paper between the jaws, and after removing it, it clicked back to zero, from the factory! Nice and smooth, unlike the Harbor Freight digital I bought a many years back. I decided to upgrade to a higher quality model for reloading, this time. NOT TEA BAG... Comes with a spare battery, and seems more well made than any of the 3 I purchased before. Not at the price I normally purchase, but for these, I might buy again for a backup, because TP Zombies you know...
customer_reviews.author: LinuxAssailant

customer_reviews.title: Good for your first set of calipers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these off of a recommendation from another Amazon review that had a showdown have the best calibers under $30. The screen is very easy to read and since I'm partially blind the larger text definitely helps. The battery cover slot is a bit flimsy and is prone to fall out but a little bit of blue tack can make it stay in place. overall, I'm quite happy with this and as long as you treat it nicely it should last quite a long time. Mine also came with a spare battery which I thought was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Foamy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace my dial (analog) calipers that I have been using for 20 years. All my motorcycle measurements are in metric so converting units all the time got annoying. These seem pretty accurate maybe to 0.001". I checked some stuff that was supposed to be very high tolerance like valve shims and got some decent verification. They are also nice because you can change the units on the fly for a conversion and they also can convert to fractions of an inch.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Jean

customer_reviews.title: Accurate With Large Display
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the iGaging IP54 for myself and the Neiko 01407A Electronic Digital Caliper for my son. I like that the iGaging had significantly larger numbers in its display. The Neiko only has whole numbers in a similar large size, while fractions and decimal numbers are about 75% smaller. That's really the only significant difference between them. Accuracy was about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died Quickly
customer_reviews.text: After several uses and a few weeks in a drawer, this caliper died. I've changed batteries and tried every which way of installing the battery and the caliper is simply not going to turn on. Since it is dead, it is not very accurate, easy to read, or easy to use. Ignore the digital part and it's almost half as good as a $2.39 manual caliper from a discount store.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: very good Caliper for the price
customer_reviews.text: after using 2 low-cost ones it was time I will get a better one (i get 2 harbor freight ones) and after 4 weeks of using its great !! in the harbor freight if you zero it out and move it up and down after the 2nd time it will start geting+-0.2 or more but using iGaging its back to 0 every time and you can test it 10 times on the same object it's going to read the same im using it now all the time (3d printing) I pick it base on the "GadgetClass" review and man its good
customer_reviews.author: Nadav Mavor

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best in this price range
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a pro, so I'm not in the market for top of the line tools, but I am picky about what I put my money into. This device couldn't have been any better for my needs. It came well packed in a nice case with paper to protect the calipers. The measurements are repeatable, nothing wiggles. The units are individually tested at the factory and come with a small test sheet. Definitely would buy again if I had to and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Diggie

customer_reviews.title: Best calipers under 100
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solid product from a mechanical engineer, far better than HF and the likes of other <$30 caliper. Only grip I have is turning it off. I would have rather pressed off till it's off than press hold and release and then it turns off but that's just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Myke

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I now have five digital calipers and none of them give me the same measurement but this is close to my last caliper I purchased at the beginning of this year. I sure them for reloading and I would like to have some confidence that the C.O.A.L. is correct. I feel a little relieved that I have two calipers that are somewhat spot on with each other. That is why I gave it a 4 star rating. I will see how long it functions before giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Delighted

customer_reviews.title: A professional grade precision instrument at consumer prices.
customer_reviews.text: As an experienced calibration technician (>20 years), I have to say the iGaging brand makes the best consumer grade precision instruments that I have run across. It is hard to match Starrett or Mitutoyo, those are more for professionals, but this caliper comes really close. When tested with calibration (AA/1/00) grade gage blocks, this caliper definitely fell within the manufacturer specification through out the full range, at 1 inch the display indicated 1.000 in, and stayed true until 5 and 6 inches where it indicated 5.0005 and 6.0005 respectively.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffster

customer_reviews.title: lots of good features for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Big numbers, fast updating when sliding, accurate measurements, this tool is a very good deal. I broke a pair of mitutoyo calipers because I use these for setting up manufacturing equipment. I don't have these sitting out next to a mill or anything like that, so sometimes they get bumped, dropped, etc. For 30 bucks, these meet my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but short battery life compared to Mitutoyo calipers.  Reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Accurate steel caliper with a very large LCD display. Rated four stars due to substantial battery draw even when off based on battery life of about 1 year whether used a lot or not. This seems to be true of the majority of inexpensive digital calipers from China that I have. Based on tests with gauge blocks and rings this is very accurate reading. Quite reliable as I have had mine for 7 years with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy seems OK, however power draw with the unit "off" must be significant because these don't get used much and it seems like the battery is *always* dead when I need to measure something. Also seems like you usually have to tilt the caliper to be able to read the LCD... not sure if this is a viewing angle issue or related to the propensity to run the battery down. Purchased this model partly for the fractional measurements, but found it not that useful. The Harbor Freight digital caliper I bought some number of years ago, I would guess for less than half the price, gives far less frustration.
customer_reviews.author: S. Saltzman

customer_reviews.title: They're Great. I Guess.
customer_reviews.text: These calipers seem to be well worth the money. They're very well built and come with a sturdy case. It is very easy to change from thousandth's to 128ths to metric. I have no idea as to their accuracy as I have no way to calibrate them. The repeatability of result is good.
customer_reviews.author: R3C

customer_reviews.title: Very good caliper
customer_reviews.text: This is a really accurate caliper. Jaws fit tight, has no gap. Made of good steel, even the plastic display feels solid. Moves nice and smooth. I have seen on the internet that some people were comparing this with $100.00 calipers and saying they are just as good as the more expensive ones. I have to agree, you get a great caliper at an extremely great price. Very, very glad I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Buddie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the hobbyist or luthier.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. These feel really solid. I checked them with several feeler gauges and guitar strings and they were spot on. They give consistent readings at the tips and closer to the body. The only thing I can see not making them perfect is that the two halves of the main body covering the electronics doesn’t completely join in one small area. If I owned a shop or depended on these for my livelihood I would still use these for day to day tasks and maybe keep the high end calipers handy for critical jobs. For the hobbyist these are well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Swank

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable digital caliper
customer_reviews.text: Great digital caliper - way easier to use than the old vernier caliper it replaced, and seems quite accurate (though I haven't done any tests). The fractional-inch feature is nice, but could really benefit from some way to limit the resolution (so it would only increment in increments of say 32nds or 64ths). When I'm shooting for say 5/8" and get a measurement of 81/128, it's kind of difficult to figure out if I'm over or under, and by how much... I'd actually prefer if it said something like 20.25/32 or even 5/8" + 1/128" or something. But that's nit-picking; otherwise this is a great tool at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sevy

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten two of these and sent both of them back because they have gaps they're nice and smooth using but not going to be precise if there's gaps. I also tried GlowGeek and MLTools SS DC8001 and MLTools is the only one that didn't have any gaps and it's very nice feeling heavy. It also has the same metic, inch and fractions. I really wanted to keep one of these because i like the feel and smoothness.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Watson

customer_reviews.title: Precision at its best.
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this to take measurements to see how far off center my table saw blade was to the miter slots. I was astounded at how far off the saw was off. In using this device I was able to get my my saw aligned with in 0.01 of an inch. Now my saw cuts as straight as a professional saw if not better. The precision that is achieved with this caliper is fantastic. The calibration is spot on and the movement is silky smooth. I will be purchasing all of my digital measuring devices from iGaging from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Queen (AKA Ewok)

customer_reviews.title: Accurate with no issues.
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. Where I work accuracy is critical and because of this we regularly have our calipers and other measuring devices checked by an outside company to make sure they’re still reading perfectly. Six months and two checks in and I have had no issues. Unlike what some have said, the battery life seems to hold up fine. Great choice for the money. As accurate as my Mititoyo.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: A very nice and affordable caliper with read out in metric, fractional inches, and decimal inches
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had purchased this years ago. This is replacing a manual caliper. It has a digital read out in metric, fractional inches, and decimal inches. How can you beat that? It sure beats trying to read the fine graduation lines of a manual scale, especially with my degraded eye sight. It calibrates every time you turn on and set to the base position. Accuracy and precision seem to be spot on.
customer_reviews.author: W. K.

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas along with a 3D Printer. He was more excited about this than the printer. Maybe because he was expecting the printer. I am sure there are better but this seems to be a really good bang for the buck. Not the cheap HF Caliper and not the really high end but it seems well made and accurate so I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mstephe51

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off after only 3 minutes of inactivity.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work out of the box. Battery was dead. No problem they send a spare with it. Big screen easy to read. Works smooth. Biggest problem I have is with the auto shut-off. Any idle time over 3 min causes the caliper's to shut off. If using for machining most cuts last more than 3 min. so your constantly turning the thing on. I've used countless digital measuring devices over the years and none have shut off in only 3 min. Usually 15-30 min. Probably would have given it a 4 if it would stay on a little while longer.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Works well and seems to be accurate. #s are ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and seems to be accurate. #s are repeatable, and there is no obvious backlash or looseness in the slide (nor is there excessive force required anywhere). I'm not in a precision field, so I cant judge them from that standpoint, but they're working well for me with hobby level things that require precise measurements (like measuring 3d printer filament). Even comes with a spare battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply great caliper
customer_reviews.text: Had this for more than 4 years. After using many calipers, some cheaper, some more expensive like Mitutoyo, this is unbeatable. I can't speak to the accuracy and toughness under harsh conditions, but for general hobbyist use it's great. Fraction mode is very useful that many other calipers don't have. Display is large and clear to read. Housing is plastic but feels good, and it slides very smoothly after years of use. Can't recommend more especially at this price. Have not come across a caliper that I like better.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Easy, reliable- I use it almost every day!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a better way to measure small dimensions while doing woodworking- thickness planning, hole or screw sizes, table saw blade and router bit positions etc. This tool is awesome from all those things. Although I use it mostly for thousands of an inch mode, it does make conversion to Mom or fractional inches easy as push a button. And on the back is etched a handy conversion chart. I now use this almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Best calipers for the money
customer_reviews.text: I did tons of research and found that these calipers are a great buy for the money. Just understand that they don’t compare with the higher end versions for accuracy. This wasn’t an issue for me since I am just using them on diy projects. I’m not building a spaceship (at least not yet). They are way better than any other caliper in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Zemaitis

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: Don't know that I need something that is hyper-accurate...but you never know. Cost was not unreasonable over the "cheaper" ones and GadgetClass's review sold me. He could be way off, but sounded like he knew a whole lot more than I even contemplated. Now that I have it, I find I have more uses for it than I ever thought I would. Using GadgetClass's review as a guide, this appeared to be the one to go for...a little more money, more assurance of accuracy. Works for me.
customer_reviews.author: DeuceDriver

customer_reviews.title: Not relatable
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, the caliper appears to be well constructed and solid. Not only did I purchase this item once but twice! I assumed the first caliper was just bad by default. Wrong! The replacement worked a few days and then, bang! Now, the caliper will not even turn on, I replaced the battery, and still no sign of life in the caliper. My review, "DON'T BUY!"
customer_reviews.author: Randog

customer_reviews.title: Very Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Excellent caliper for the price. I needed to measure the outside diameter of some pipe/tubing so that i could purchase the matching size. I figured I could take a ruler to do this and I was very wrong haha. So I purchased this caliper and was amazed by the accuracy. I was measuring 1" OD outside diameter tubing and when i used this device it measured 1.000". I was so impressed that it was dead on and not something like 1.020 or 1.006. Highly recommend this caliper as it is a lifesaver the few times you do need it (I admit there are limited uses for such item).
customer_reviews.author: SK Wire

customer_reviews.title: could not have been happier
customer_reviews.text: OKAY a lot of time you are disappointed by something you buy on line and sometimes you just expect it not to be perfect but I was overwhelmed by the quality of this device. It is extremely well made for any price if I paid a 100$ for it I would have been happy with it. The display is large and very accurate. easy to use and just WOW. I have been using a plastic one for a long time but it got wet ...glad that happened now this is SO much better.
customer_reviews.author: John WenzelburgerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy without paranoia
customer_reviews.text: I love quality tools but I hate dropping or losing them. I ordered this caliber so that I wouldn't have to take my Mitutoyo out of the shop to go measure things at the suppliers. The build quality is really good and it feels good in your hand because there has been care taken in finishing the tool. Accuracy has been excellent and consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Novak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Caliper
customer_reviews.text: I bought this caliper after reading the reviews and was really happy with it. It is actually very precise and I was able to measure in cm both inside and outside dimensions on some of my things and was able to find the correct sized replacement parts for them. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the others!
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered another one. These are better than any of the others I've tried. They don't turn on automatically when you use them, which means they also don't turn themselves on constantly. They stay zeroed, and the action is smooth. I use these a lot & I've gone through a bunch of them.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Zoom

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tool for the right job
customer_reviews.text: This gives good quality measurements and much easier to use than the traditional vernier scale tool. It is worth going digital, though you have to rely on a watch battery to power it. I unplug it after every use to keep it from coming on accidentally. The thumbwheel is a little stiff, but still worked well for me, working with mollusk shell measurements. Vendor got the tool to me quickly and in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Smooth. Accurate. Repeatable. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after thorough research online and reading reviews. High quality. Rigid enough to prevent reading inaccuracies if any twisting of the instrument happens while using. I like the large, easy-to-read numerals. Readings appear to be very accurate and repeatable. I’m a woodworker and really like the fraction readout. The action is very smooth. Wish I bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D

customer_reviews.title: Really good value, helps me constantly
customer_reviews.text: This has completely saved me on quite a few measurements. Three modes, inches, millimeters, and inch fractions The comprehensive reviews here are much better than anything I could write. I bought this instead of a similarly priced option based on the reviews. It has returned to Zero every single time. The jaws align perfectly, no gaps. It came with an extra battery, which is good because the one installed was DOA. I'm not building space stations, but I do need pretty good precision, if not ultimate accuracy. So far, this is proving to be a very worthwhile purchase. I would easily recommend this to anyone in the market for a digital caliper.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, precise, repeatable
customer_reviews.text: I use this for measuring parts for 3D printing projects. It has the accuracy and precision I need, and measurements are repeatable with no variation or drift. I've been using it regularly for 3 or 4 months now, and the battery is still going strong. It even came with an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matulich

customer_reviews.title: AVOID. Stopped working within a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I was gentle with this thing the few times I used it. Stuck it in a drawer for a few months and when I went to use it again it was dead. Figured it was a simple dead battery so I ordered a 5 pack off Amazon. No dice. Even with the new batteries it's dead. Pretty disappointing considering it was around $30 (plus out another $6 in batteries).
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this caliper. I originally purchased one from cabelas but it wouldn't always read the same while measuring the same item repeatedly. I bought this one to replace it and so far it's been awesome. The screen is easy to read and it always seems to return to zero correctly. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Ol King Kohl

customer_reviews.title: Great precision tool without having to pay for the certified price tag
customer_reviews.text: Great set of calipers. Finally, a set that slides smoothly and keeps its zero reference. I can use this all day and not have to worry about the measurements being off because the calipers get inaccurate or the zero reference drifts. Features I usually have to spend a lot of extra money with certified tools.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Helber

customer_reviews.title: but other than that this caliper is fantastic. Very accurate against my scientific grade rulers
customer_reviews.text: Needed a little silicon lube on the slide groove after unboxing, but other than that this caliper is fantastic. Very accurate against my scientific grade rulers, pretty sensitive to .01 mm and simple to switch between mm, inches (decimal) and inches (fractional). Feels sturdy, too. Comes with an extra battery which is also easy to replace. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Butler

customer_reviews.title: Little concern...
customer_reviews.text: In general this digital caliper is very good but i found the only one glitch in design. I can push any buttons to turn device on and only one designated button to turn it off. 3 buttons are too high, and easy to push accidentally or can be self activated even inside off the case what can cause quick battery drain.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: It is good high quality as reviewed.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. Zeros every time. No slip in reading when wiggled. Perfectly good to use and accurate as seen in a you tube video where someone reviewed these. Good value for the accuracy. Don’t buy the cheap ones unless you don’t care about accuracy and precision.
customer_reviews.author: YT

customer_reviews.title: This is the mid-range caliper you need
customer_reviews.text: It's beautiful. Comes in a nice case with good foam padding, very crisp movement, displays in, mm, fractions; large, clear display; I'm not as expert as some of the guys, but it seems very good quality to me, and at a very reasonable price. Stay away from the low end clones; get something decent and use it for a nice long time. Outstanding support from both the seller and the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy the Man

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using dial calipers for years, but everything seems to be moving to digital so I decided to try it. I've checked it a few times, it seems pretty accurate, and gives me a quick answer....Out to decimal places with very little value. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: ... have gone back and forth about battery operated devices like these. If I don't use it often enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I have gone back and forth about battery operated devices like these. If I don't use it often enough the battery always is dead when I need it. So I wanted to add just one digital caliper back into my shop because there are times when it is easier to use/read. Still take the battery out between uses hoping it will not have gone dead just sitting there. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Red Stick

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It's been a few years since I bought this, but I barely ever use it. Just like every other cheap chinese caliper I can find, broke after realistically 15 minutes of use. Battery is not the problem
customer_reviews.author: rsheldiii

customer_reviews.title: Love the fractions feature!
customer_reviews.text: I have used cheap plastic calipers so much I decided to invest in something a little more robust and accurate. This caliper is excellent! Locking feature works great for fixing a dimension to mark multiple parts. Seems very well built so I expect a reasonable life. Have been using now for several months with no problems. I use it often to size a drill bit to a fastener. Great time saver!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P. Schieffer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality DIY-grade digital caliper
customer_reviews.text: This is a good-quality digital caliper for a DIY or hobbyist for a great price. I have been using it for over a year, and it's continued to provide easy, accurate measurements. The three display options (decimal inch, fractional inch, and decimal millimeters) are one of the main reasons I went with this model instead of other similar devices. I've found all three display units to be very useful, and the large display is very convenient. The original battery is still going strong, and it was even shipped with a spare battery. This probably wouldn't hold up to the same abuse as a far more expensive Starrett or other professional-grade caliper, but for my home workshop, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a low cost (not cheap) digital caliper. So far I used it to measure disc brake calipers (ironic, no?). I found the case robust enough for my needs, with extra storage for a battery and two coins. You can use two coins to measure brake calipers to "reach" about an inch into where the brake pad touches. I will introduce my son into accurate measurements with this. That's what this is for, no more. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Derwood

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe I got this so inexpensively, this is a great tool. BUY THIS ONE not the cheap knockoffs, that frankly arent that much cheaper. This thing works, its reliable, its easy to use and read.. I just wish I had bought the bigger version, but thats on me. This caliper is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: knowmad

customer_reviews.title: Can’t find anything wrong
customer_reviews.text: Was gonna buy American or mitutoyo but after research found these. For the price you can’t beat em. If you’re not union and getting tools free through work, these are a good accurate option. Outside of real precision machining holding (.00003~) tolerances I would say pull the trigger on these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very precise, seems accurate
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is very precise and was very helpful in comparing paper thickness. My repeated measurements never deviated more than 0.01mm. As for accuracy, I don't have any items of known exact thickness so I'll trust in this caliper's measurements. The construction of this item seems very good, it comes with a carrying case and 2 batteries (1 is already installed). It never seems to lose track of where it is, even if you move it back and fourth quickly. Example measurements: Receipt Paper: 0.04mm Printer Paper: 0.10mm US Dollar Bill: 0.11mm Business Card: 0.36mm
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Smith

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of calipers
customer_reviews.text: I've had these calipers for a while now, and I love them. First, they're accurate. I've done some extensive testing, and found that the measurements taken with these calipers are both accurate and repeatable. Having a digital display is great, not just because it's easy to read, but also because you can press one button to cycle through readings in millimeters, fraction inches, and decimal inches. These calipers are very well made, and I'd definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: leo

customer_reviews.title: iGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Very nice digital caliper for the price and accurate. Great for the DIY'er or garage mechanic. I love that the display is large and the caliper will switch between millimeter, inch, and fraction which makes it very handy. It also provides (4) digits past the decimal for SAE which I have not seen from other calipers in this price range. 6" overall in length is perfect for my applications. Very handy tool to have around the shop and it comes with a nice storage case.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: iGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel Body These are working great for me, I used them daily and haven't had any issues, I've been using them for almost a year at the time of writing this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, will die on you
customer_reviews.text: Like many here, used it for one month. Left it came back and was dead. Changed battery, still dead. Checked battery voltage (3.3V) still dead. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3d printer, and while it isn't SUPER accurate, it meets the accuracy needs for my projects. I would buy this again, and I would recommend it to friends. I like that it also came with an extra battery and a hard case.
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but fractions mode is annoying
customer_reviews.text: The caliper is nicely made. My complaint about it is when using it in fractions mode, it delivers results in 128ths of an inch. A bit annoying to be converting 77/128ths to something resembling drill bit sizes (did it take you a moment to realize that 77/128ths was bit larger than 19/32nds? I would have preferred it did it in 64ths at most (perhaps with a + sign to show it was a 128th over?)
customer_reviews.author: Larry in FL

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality calipers and very accurate. Comparing it to the Harbor Freight calipers which I was previously borrowing, it feels better to use, the inch fractions are actually very convenient to have, and it just feels higher quality overall. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is that I personally think it should slide a little bit smoother than it does. This may vary unit to unit, I'm unsure. Overall, I'm happy with these calipers and believe they will last me basically my whole life.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome buy. I use this device at least 10 times a day designing many 3D printable items. I have only zeroed it a few times, preforming even a large measurement and returning it to the closed 0 point, it always returns to "0.00". This caliper yields repeatable accurate measurements. It feels solid, has a good smooth sliding motion, and great battery life. Once a measurement is made, each press of the units button will convert to/from mm/Inches decimal/Inches Fraction. There is no doubt in my mind that I bought the right Caliper!. Extremely happy with this purchase. I'm sure you too will be happy with this model.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ellison

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Brand new item revceived on 03/15/2017. Can't get to turn on. Got a new battery and still will not light up.
customer_reviews.author: jason marks

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality with Value and Low Price
customer_reviews.text: After researching several less expensive Digital Calipers, I decided on this one. I have been very pleased with my decision. The accuracy and ease of use is perfect for my needs. This product does everything I need for it to do and includes a decent case and extra battery. I certainly didn't need a top of the line Caliper due to the likely hood of other people "borrowing" it and damaging it. Some of the people in our shop could break an anvil with a rubber mallet. : )
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Going strong three years later!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product at a good price. I have had it for three years now and it works great. It is repeatable to much less than 1 mm, and it holds it's zero setting very well; I haven't had to reset the zero (fully closed) for months. I have no way to measure its accuracy, but for my needs measuring optical thread sizes and other small parts, it works like a charm, and is very repeatable. I treat it like a delicate instrument, but it seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Paonessa

customer_reviews.title: Almost too accurate for woodworking
customer_reviews.text: I use calipers in my workshop all the time and my only problem is that its so accurate I'm not used to reading measurements in 128th increment. Makes is a bit challenging to round it to the nearest 16th which is close as I ever need to be outside of tool set up. Very nice caliper though.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate at a reasonable cost
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with a not-so-inexpensive pair of digital calipers for over three years now. After each measurement I would have to re-zero the old one after closing the jaws. With this, I calibrated it the first time I used it and it has returned to zero every time since. I love it. I look forward to having to use it. A really good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: The display is great, and they turn themselves off after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Starrett dial caliper I use at work. Of course these aren't as smooth, and the jaws aren't as finely machined, but they are completely precise, accurate, and provide repeatable measurements every time. Oh yeah, and they cost about a quarter as much as Starretts. The display is great, and they turn themselves off after a few minutes so the batteries aren't dead every time you need them. I'm completely happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: cheviswhite

customer_reviews.title: The power button does not work very well.
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I used this caliper very frequently, because I do a lot of 3D modeling and 3D printing. Ever since I got it, I have struggled to turn it on and off. To this day I still haven't found the sweet spot on the power button, and it will take me up to TWO MINUTES to turn it on or off. If they can fix that then it would be a perfect product. I bought a mechanical caliper for double the money.
customer_reviews.author: Corey P. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for 3d printing
customer_reviews.text: Feels well made. I like the optional display in fractional inches (plus mm and decimal inches). The case probably wouldn't hold up to heavy duty use, but will do fine keeping it safe in a tool drawer. Came with a spare battery. Digital display was very steady - not flipping rapidly between nearby readings.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kolberg

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy. Had the same result after several measurements of the same item.
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as described. Easy to setup and very easy to read with the large display. Although I seldom need four figure accuracy when measuring small items it is nice to know I have a tool that I can depend on.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Matthews

customer_reviews.title: I noted some negative reviews but do not understand why others would not like this product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast, goo product. No defects; worked as described. I noted some negative reviews but do not understand why others would not like this product. I use it in the workshop (woodworking) and have absolutely NO PROBLEMS. This is a quality item, especially for the price. I guess if you were a professional machines you may want something else... but for the woodworker: GET ONE! I would purchase this again and will buy other products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley D Lantz

customer_reviews.title: iGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I tested them against my Mitutoyo 500-752-20 on a couple of test blocks ( .5, 1.5 and 3.0) and the reading was dead perfect. That is saying something for a 30.00 set of calipers. Smooth slide and wide jaws they are everything a reloader needs. I am impressed so far but if they only last a couple of years I am still impressed for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mrbruce

customer_reviews.title: Switches are Bad
customer_reviews.text: This caliper will turn itself on and off, change ranges and zero settings while holding it in your hand. I have on occasion turned it off and put it back in the case. When I open the case it is on. It kills batteries because it will not turn off or it will turn off while using it. I finally gave up and purchased a different brand. It is too delicate and the switches are very flaky.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Scurlock

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Work exactly as described. I would stay away from anything cheaper, this is real entry level if you want any sort of accuracy. For the home DYI or hobby stuff this works great, if you want professional quality and features then you will have to spend way more, although these are good they are pro grade by any stretch
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very accurate and I really like the refresh rate of the screen it's almost instant not like my old one that took a second. The numbers are Huuuuuge! Nicely made low price caliper! I bought this based on the other 5 star reviews and I can say they're not wrong!
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and precise for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice caliper for the money. I have a analog caliper and needed a more precise caliper to measure a replacement lens of 30.4mm for my watch. The measurements were accurate and got the correct lens for the repair of the watch. I would order this again from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: nikboom

customer_reviews.title: 5-star calipers
customer_reviews.text: I very rarely give a 5-star review but these calipers deserve it. I had been living with a cheaper set that were inaccurate and didn't measure in fractions. I think I had to zero these calipers once. I adjust them, turn them off and leave on the bench for a week, come back and turn them on and the display measures exactly where I left them. Very solid construction and they are heavy. Good materials. I don't like the case but I'm prone to not using them anyway because they get so much use. Would buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: fullbirdmusic

product_meta.title: iGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel Body
product_meta.description: Igaging premium precision professional grade tool Super high quality measuring device. Easy read with the largest LCD display available. No other caliper offer you 4 digits Decimal in SAE mode or 1/128 inch fractional display. This caliper offers IP54 resistance protection against dust splash water and oil. Features: easy read Super large display (2-3/8"x7/8") IP54 - splash water, oil and dust resistant hardened stainless steel precision lapping finish range: 0-6 inch accuracy: 0.001 inch repeatability: 0.0005 inch resolution: 0.0005"/0.01mm/1/128".

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
